location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Lockyer Merewether, Kurrachee [Karachi] to Lewis Pelly

mods.abstract: Letter regarding the satisfactory state of affairs in the Gulf and suggestions made to William McKinnon to link of the Busreh [Basra] and Aden line of steamers with the Gulf through Bunder Abbass [Bandar Abbas].The letter also relays news from home, reporting on opposition attempts to remove Disraeli from his position as Prime Minister and matters in parliament relating to the United States of America.The letter concludes by summarising Charles Henry Harrison's handling of matters in Kelat.
